title: Ensure Study Article flow renders real backend article content and blocks placeholder content

requirements.summary: Harden the Study article flow so it renders the backend-provided article reliably and shows an explicit error when generation fails or returns placeholder-only content.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the Study button for a wrong-answered question shows the full article content returned by the backend
The Study article view shows a clear error state if article generation fails (no silent fallback to placeholder text)
The Study article view continues to show the question reference and article title/content in a readable, scrollable layout as it does today

file_operations.description: Add client-side validation for the returned Article so placeholder-only content (e.g., the known placeholder sentence starting with "This is a generated long-form educational article...") is treated as an error by throwing, ensuring the UI never renders placeholder content and instead enters an explicit error state.

Update the Study Article view to handle the hookâ€™s validation/errors cleanly: keep the existing readable, scrollable layout for question reference + article title/content; ensure error copy is clear and in English; and ensure there is no fallback rendering path that could display placeholder-only content when generation fails.
